website_summaries.verdict: An eco-friendly monitor that is particularly good for those who suffer from monitor-induced eye strain.
pros: Features a 7 millisecond overdrawn response time
Offers a number of eco-friendly features
Good quality color, while the overall monitor helps with eye strain
cons: Some buyers claim durability issues, with this option dying within a few months to a year
Stand is on the cheap side

customer_reviews.title: Went bad in 1 year
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this monitor for one year. Today, lines and distorted images appeared on the screen indicating that it was going bad. Upon calling tech support, they told us there would be a $59.99 Fee for diagnostics. The monitor only cost $99 so, NO we are not going to do that. I think a monitor should last more than 1 year. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working from home due to covid-19
customer_reviews.text: I had to create an at home office due to the virus and my company emptying our office. This monitor has been amazing! I am using my Microsoft surface pro along with it for 2 screens. i got the 21 in screen and its perfect for my needs! I am using an hdmi cable and purchased the amazon basics converting cable.
customer_reviews.author: CA0122

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for a solid monitor!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent monitor! As you can see from the photo. I bought two of them. Dual monitors are the way to go. Multi-tasking at it's best! Since it doesn't have any audio outputs; I use Bluetooth from my laptop to a JBL Charge 2 Bluetooth Speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Screen Flashes Black
customer_reviews.text: The screen flashes black every once in a while like it's trying to change resolution. I've updated the drivers for both the monitor and my graphics card to no avail. It's not an issue with my computer as my second monitor of a different brand works perfectly. If I ever find a resolution for this problem I'll change my rating and explain how to fix it in case others have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Zabeth

customer_reviews.title: While the monitor was inexpensive and had a great display for the price
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one year to the day that I received it. These 4 odd looking pixilated lines appeared in the middle of the screen and come and go. You only notice them on a white background. While the monitor was inexpensive and had a great display for the price, one year later it is time to start looking for a new one. Of course the warranty has long run out.
customer_reviews.author: smart shopper

customer_reviews.title: Came on time!
customer_reviews.text: This came earlier today so I'm just uploading it now, and it came on time! Great monitor screen and amazing color! It's great for computers and for ps4, yes! Ps4. Easy hook up, no problem at all. But I do suggest speakers If you wanna play your ps4 with sound. But Just use your ps4 head set or some ear buds for sound or buy some speakers for the monitor, other than that its good to go. See you again soon Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: lamon hairston

customer_reviews.title: 2 defective monitors !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordering these monitors have been a nightmare. First an amazon rep told me my shipment was late due to my payment not going through . Later a supervisor told me that was incorrect just delivery delays . When I finally received the delivery, I confirmed BOTH monitors were defective! Would not turn on! I had to speak with HP support for over an hour ! Additionally the 1 year warranty wasn’t showing appropriately with HP. Luckily with proof of purchase I was able to get the 1 year warranty date updated. Horrible horrible experience. Especially during these times .
customer_reviews.author: Julez N.

customer_reviews.title: Software Issues
customer_reviews.text: From the beginning the monitor was a disappointment. It only worked properly for about two months. The software to adjust the screen is junk. Furthermore, the monitor seems to have some compatibility issues with windows 10. Don’t expect any help from HP. Never purchasing a HP product again. Who knew purchasing a simple monitor would be so much trouble. Last but not least, the picture is not that great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good Monitor, Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is great and this monitor was super easy to install. I saw other comments about HDMI/HDMI not working good with other monitors that I compared this one to so went ahead and purchased a VGA/HDMI connector just in case that was an issue for this one. It wasn't and I also already had a HDMI/HDMI connector so checked with that connector and it worked too. Hopefully I won't need to come back for an update on this review--but so far, this monitor is working great!
customer_reviews.author: Loulou

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but for a reason
customer_reviews.text: Good price, but for a reason. Great resolution, but it doesn't always connect. Purchased for my home office and about half the time I have trouble connecting. It says no signal even though it's clearly plugged in. Even when I unplug and replug everything. I thought it was a bad VGA cable and Amazon support was nice enough to send me an HDMI cable but it still continues to happen. Don't bother with HP support - that was a huge waste of time. Amazon support was much more helpful, but do yourself a favor and don't purchase this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Jamey Chapin

customer_reviews.title: Great value & crisp picture but lacks color accuracy for pro applications
customer_reviews.text: This HP 21.5” IPS monitor has great picture quality and is an excellent monitor for the price. It’s a perfect option for the everyday consumer for web browsing, watching video and casual gaming. The color accuracy isn’t quite up to the level for serious photo/video editors or color grading. It’s decent option as a secondary/additional monitor, for keeping an eye on things outside the main workflow. Also, the response time is fine for the everyday gamer, but competitive gamers/frame buffs are going to want a faster response time. That said, for under $100, monitor is compelling option.
customer_reviews.author: Shellz & AJ

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a year, then a purple line appeared in the middle of the screen.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a year, then a vertical purple line appeared in the middle of the screen. Others seem to have had the same issue. Not sure if it is a common problem with monitors those days, but this is the first time I have had a monitor do that. It's still usable I guess, but I wouldn't recommend buying that screen.
customer_reviews.author: luciep

customer_reviews.title: Ok for low budget, but not for a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2 of these monitors. Initially they seemed good. After few months of use, I am having issues with either of the monitors freezing up while in the middle of my work. HP customer support is way too hard to reach. They keep rerouting to so many hops. Further, having hell of a time making it VESA compatible to mount. The only VESA adapter for this model is too costly compared to the price of this monitor. Not a good purchase in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Virginian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot understand why the negative reviews for this monitor because I bought an ASUS 24 inch monitor that was supposed to be better and ended up returning it because it would flicker and the brightness would hurt my eyes even though I would turn the brightness down. This monitor is better than ASUS in the same price range, the brightness doesn't hurt my eyes, and no flickering. I had configured the ASUS monitor's refresh rate, used an HDMI cable and it still flickered. I love this monitor! Will probably buy another one for work! 5+ stars!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: More hours less fatigue!
customer_reviews.text: Better than advertised! It came in 2 days (I did not pay for extra fast shipping). It was very simple to set up and fits on my hanging wall desk just perfectly. The size if great -big enough to set up two sets of tabs for my work and still read all the numbers side by side. I stare at a screen for hours at a time and this one has me much less fatigued than the one it replaced. I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Working from home with only my laptop monitor became a hassle. I know I needed a second monitor but I did not want to spend an arm and a leg to get one. This was the second most affordable monitor on amazon. It came pretty quickly and the set up was easy. The monitor comes with a power adapter and a vga cord. It does not include a hdmi cable so you’ll have to purchase that separately. It’s allows for a wide amount of adjustments to the color and brightness of the screen. Once you plug in your connector cord just adjust your laptop setting under multiple displays to ‘extend these displays’ and you’ll be good to go!
customer_reviews.author: N&J

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This monitor will neither win any awards nor have the best picture, but it gets the job done for a low price. I bought two of these monitors for my home office so I could have dual-monitors to complete excel workbooks more efficiently. For basic home/business use cases, this monitor is great and seems to be of decent quality. If you're looking for a more expensive display that will bring out all the colors and richness of higher end digital cameras, or you want something for gaming, this monitor is probably not for you. But for most basic home uses, this monitor is great.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: A really good monitor
customer_reviews.text: The monitor arrived with excellent protective packing that is worth keeping for future moves. In VGA mode it synced to my 1280 X 800 laptop screen automatically although it is not listed as preset. Clone display mode and extended display mode make working the PC a pleasure In HDMI I am using it as an entertainment center in a small room Combined it with a ViewTV At-263 OTA converter, rabbit ears, a 64GB Cruzer flash drive for DVR recording and extended cable connected headphones. 1080i TV program display is crystal clear as well as recordings. Great monitor and very well built with a good solid base stand. At $160 for the whole set-up this was a bargain
customer_reviews.author: JHCTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: 8 months of use, a year and a half of frustration.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in May 2018. It worked great for 8 months. After that, it refused to work reliably or well, constantly flickering on/off, or just turning off altogether. I unplugged it over a year ago out of frustration, occasionally trying it out and having continuous problems. After well over a year of it being defunct, I finally realized it was just taking up space and trashed it.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Chan

customer_reviews.title: failing after 11k hours
customer_reviews.text: Short and sweet, I'm reviewing this after my purchase in 2017 because it's failing. It's been well taken care of and not handled often but despite this, it's developed a black horizontal line in the middle of the screen. Pressing the bottom of the monitor together temporarily fixes it - leading me to believe the ribbons have degraded over time and the connection isn't 100% anymore at the TAP. 3 days into failing, and it's progressed into flickering to a black screen for a moment, comes back on it's own for now. TL:DR Cheap, good for office - expect to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't expecting it to be this good
customer_reviews.text: I use it for home office work. I tried a 24" first but it was too big. This 22" is just perfect. Build quality is very good and the picture quality is outstanding, especially using HDMI hookup. VGA is good but HDMI is quite better. If you've got $100 to spend on a monitor for desk applications, then this one cannot be beat. I couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: This is a poor product with poor support.
customer_reviews.text: Believe me, I always write fair reviews. This was a great monitor at a great price, until it wasn't. I bought it about a year ago. Frequently, it turns on and displays a pink image over the whole display. I have to turn it off then back on for this pink image to go away. It also has a dead pixel. My monitor is still in warranty, so I called HP technical support. I got through to a monitor technician, who insisted that the monitor had to be tested on a PC. I only have Macs. I politely insisted that the problem was the monitor. He then disconnected me. The price is nice, but I'd recommend against buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Crook

customer_reviews.title: Good for text, horrible for photos and videos - bad contrast levels
customer_reviews.text: The contrast levels are horrible. It's fine for text and spreadsheet work when you have obviously diverse colors and tones, but forget about using this for photos or videos or any significant graphics. I don't regret buying it as I wanted quick and cheap and a resolution to match my notebook. But the five year old display on the notebook blows this one away. I wouldn't buy this monitor again.
customer_reviews.author: Ferg Fam

customer_reviews.title: With so many great reviews and a great
customer_reviews.text: With so many great reviews and a great, I did not hesitate to make this purchase. I was not disappointed! It is a fantastic display. For those 4k nerds and gamers who bought it and were disappointed, what were you expecting? I am reasonably certain that this is one of the best overall values on Amazon. I bought it to use with my new Chrome book. I'll be reviewing that too, but I want more time with it first. One clarification: one of the comparison charts indicates that it comes with an HDMI cable. It comes with a VGA cable only. It's pretty simple. It is an awesome monitor for those that do not need high-end specifications. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: mrbillhertz

customer_reviews.title: ive had two monitors for 4 years
customer_reviews.text: ive gotten two of these back in 2016 and i can say that it was well worth the price of 200$ for two. i haven't had any issues with picture quality or sharpness since i owned them, playing games on max settings from my gtx 1070 with no problems either. good buy if your cheap but if you have the money i would choose an 144hz screen instead of these 60 hz sceens.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty62

customer_reviews.title: No HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.text: Great price on a great looking (picture quality) monitor. Did not come with HDMI cable. Luckily i had a spare or it would have gone back to Amazon. It did ship with outdated useless VGA cable however. Update: just yook delivery on another one as my probably 10yr old hp started showing " ant wars" instead of what it was supposed to. No HDMI CABLE again. Product description and check list show HDMI cable. VGA is what was in 2 of these boxes. 1920x1080 is no guarantee of picture quality. Its OK but no sony trinitron.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy James

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice for a MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I have a 15 inch, 2018 MacBook Pro running Mojave and this monitor drives me CRAZY. It blinks off frequently (but no pattern to it - it's not on a regular time interval, so I can't figure out what causes it) and it causes BOTH of my screens (this monitor and the build-in screen) to shift several pixels to the side and then back again frequently as well. It's incredibly annoying and nothing I've tried fixes it. I give up. I'm buying something else. DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE A MACBOOK PRO.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Would be good if wasn't so self-destructive.
customer_reviews.text: The stand is terrible. It will not lock into place at all, and as such will easily dump the monitor onto your desk or floor at the slightest provocation. It's a shame, because the display itself is actually quite nice. If you're reading this and thinking, that's ok, I'm going to put it on a mount, think again: you need a vesa adapter because they chose to forgo having that built in.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Donym

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend if not for screen discoloration after just one year of use
customer_reviews.text: I loved my HP 22CWA 21.5inch monitor: bright, clear, great color rendering and excellent for work and gaming. Unfortunately, a discolored blotch has appeared on the screen after just over a year of use. The screen hasn't been moved, dropped, man-handled or damaged since I installed it last year, so not sure why this blotch has appeared. Hopefully this is just a lemon, because otherwise, it's a great screen.
customer_reviews.author: Farris B

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: was looking for a second monitor, that wasn't too huge. This one is perfect. not bulky, nice edge.. that is most of the monitor is actually monitor and not any type of framing. I run this one off of HDMI, had an extra cable from a TV purchase. Super Easy setup, for me it was Plug and Play. came with a CD.. no idea why.. didn't use it... who has CD players in laptops any more... it does not adjust up and down.. only tilts, but the height is perfect. if you wanted it higher you'd have to put something under it. I may buy another, i like it that much.
customer_reviews.author: Lucie

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my home office
customer_reviews.text: I work from home now and this monitor makes that much more convenient. I don't game so I can't provide an accurate "gaming" evaluation. the monitor is great for my work needs though!
customer_reviews.author: Donald W SantiagoMeyers

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: My favorite 1080p monitor, I have two! Purchased as a secondary gaming monitor. Bezel is nice and thin and overall picture quality is perfect for this generation of monitor. The only issue I have with this monitor would be that it still uses VGA/HDMI as primary hookups instead of HDMI/displayport, which I feel would be more convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Chase K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I got this today and pulled it out of the box. Easy set up ...except it won't turn on! Pulled up reviews and most of the RECENT reviews have the exact same issue. Note to self: read current reviews! What a dud. All parts clipped in nicely and it LOOKS nice, but I need it to actually turn on. BACK IT GOES!
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: This monitor is better than the 4:3 type monitors
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is better than the 4:3 monitors "square monitors" . The display quality is more HD than the traditional monitors I used to own. With the price you cannot go wrong. I could of paid more for one of these monitors. It has VGA, but VGA should be obsolete. I have to get a display port adapter and a DVI to HDMI adapter cable to get my true HD display back and be ready for watching Blu Ray movies. The monitor I used to have was acting weird, and it was from another company. It was making me very board. I had to buy this one, because it's a HP, and it's very compatible with my SFF desktop PC.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ebel

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, not compatible with monitor stands
customer_reviews.text: I love the sleek look and feel of these monitors, but they don't even have mounting holes in the back? i only see one hole and it's in a weird spot. Apparently, you need to buy an additional adapter to be able to attach a stand to it. A bit misleading, should be more clear about this in description and pictures. Anyway, the built in stand looks ok too. It's flat and placed in a way that still looks pretty sleek, and you can actually use the space too, so I'm not too bummed about the incompatibility with the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy O.

customer_reviews.title: This was packaged well and works fine..
customer_reviews.text: This was packaged well and works fine... except. It has some dead transistors. One dead right out of the box, and then another one showed up recently. It's otherwise a fine little monitor, but dead transistors are horrifically distracting, and one expects that not to happen when the monitor is brand new out of the box, and handled with gentleness while being unpacked and set up. It's not enough to go through the bother of packing it back up and returning it, as it's such a big delicate product, but I'm having second thoughts about buying a second one for the other computer. If tiny black dots that you can't fix bother you, don't risk it by getting this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor for my needs. Note,it does not come with an HDMI cable, but it does come with a blue VGA cord. I hooked it up to my HP Pavillon laptop via an HDMI connection. It linked immediately. I needed a second monitor to run Teams on my laptop w/ webcam and run gradebook applications simultaneously. This makes my job easier and more efficient. Awesome. I just had to get used to the cursor positioning going from one screen to the other.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Super Monitor - Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: This HP 21.5" LED HDMI Monitor is just plain Outstanding ! - With resolution of 1920 x 1080 it gives you a crisp and beautiful screen....The only issue is " It does not have " Speakers " and I missed that when I ordered It. But, for the price you can not go wrong. I just connected a single speaker to my HP tower and I now have sound. I especially like the HDMI connected and VGA connection. They both located directly on the back of the monitor and your cable plugs straight in. No more having to tip the monitor over.....
customer_reviews.author: G.M.

customer_reviews.title: Jsk
customer_reviews.text: Everyone works really nice and has really good quality but I messed with the settings as much as I could I turned everything to max and the monitor is still so so so dim the lighting kinda succs and looks way darker then my second monitor even with the different color settings and stuff doesn’t brighten up nicely but u can adjust the brightness but then it’s like a eye bleeding screen so either dark and dim or bright like the sun but I’m happy with it pretty good for a multi task monitor but I don’t use that one for gaming tbh just for like YouTube and other things but it’s a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a monitor for work so I could connect my laptop to it in order to have a better desk set up, and I'm not disappointed at all! For $100 it's a great monitor. It's light weight, has good picture quality, doesn't take up a ton of desk room while still having a good screen size, and it doesn't downgrade the quality of the resolution too terribly from my macbook pro. I recently started using it for gaming as well and it delivers. A great buy if you're looking for a solid monitor that won't break the bank!
customer_reviews.author: Zoe B.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful price and a great product. This is a high quality sleek design monitor with near perfect pixel color. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Adam

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, but *NO* VESA mount adapter
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: Despite clearly stating in the product features that there would be "an included VESA mount adapter kit," no such adapter or kit was included. It was a primary reason for selecting this monitor over many others. Now, the monitors are actually quite nice. Set up was simple and easy. Although, despite being billed as "bezel-less" the screen image stops 3/8" from the bezel. Still excellent monitors, but very disappointed that I have to find an off-brand VESA adapter on my own.
customer_reviews.author: Defender2

customer_reviews.title: Why pair a mounting arm with a product that doesn't accommodate it?
customer_reviews.text: This was paired with the item as a add on "AmazonBasics Single Computer Monitor Stand – Height Adjustable Desk Arm Mount, Steel." The back of this monitor does not have a mount. Also, why would you includ a software disk when almost no computer has a disk slot. Software is mostly downloaded through the manufacturer website. Feeling less than excited about this product and am not certain if it will even pan out now. Moving forward and will see how far I get. *sigh*
customer_reviews.author: Alisa J. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Really nice monitor.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 1080p monitor and I love it. It's nice and bright, the colors look great, and I do believe I'm getting the full 60fps out of it. I think I would notice otherwise as I do play a decent amount of games. I've had it for just under a year now and there are no issues. It swivels up/down a little bit if you need to adjust it, and the settings buttons are out of sight which may be a slight annoyance to some as they're a bit more difficult to reach because of it, but that's a huge plus for me as I think they're unsightly when they're on the front.
customer_reviews.author: JoeBukkit

customer_reviews.title: Love them! I bought another after having one for ...
customer_reviews.text: Love them! I bought another after having one for a month. Cheapest and best quality that I could find, love that it was also prime
customer_reviews.author: Bought It

customer_reviews.title: Overall, great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am satisfied with this product. It was easy to set up; it was fairly easy to install as a second monitor; it arrived a day early (thanks Amazon!). Screen is not as bright as I was hoping. Picture quality is okay. Not sure I would recommend it for gaming (I am not a gamer), but most likely it would work fine. I like that the monitor, even all put together with the stand it comes with, does not take up a lot of room on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Dawnelle F Ward

customer_reviews.title: Flickers and red flashing pixels after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: probably won't be getting any more HP monitors. Mine have been flickering and flashing red pixels. Will be going with a different brand from now on. Update 7/20/19: Apparently I had a defective DisplayPort to HDMI cable which was making the monitor have red flashing pixels and blackouts. I have since moved to a HDMI cable from my GPU to my monitor and no issues whatsoever. I have two of these monitors and now only one of them flashes to a black screen every couple hours or so. Probably seems to have gone away. Updated my review from 1 star to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Landon Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Bad scan memory after two years
customer_reviews.text: Use with RPi 3 and 4, works at all possible resolutions. Bright, crisp, great contrast. Still working fine after 2 years of always on. Excellent value. UPDATE: Purchased May 2018. Now in May 2020 I have rows of green dots across the display separated by 8 pixels. Clearly some sort of memory defect has developed. Dropped by rating from 5 to 2 stars (not to 1 star because it did work very well for 2 years).
customer_reviews.author: pidloop

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality, but with a few minor flaws
customer_reviews.text: Nice, good quality display. Works pretty much as well as you'd expect. I do have a couple complaints though. First, despite claiming to support DDC/CI (it even has an option for enabling and disabling it in the settings menu) it seems like this monitor doesn't work well with the DDC. While all my other monitors' brightness settings can be controlled using the software I'm using ClickMonitorDDC 3.5 this monitor ignores commands from the software and doesn't seem to work with it at all. Secondly, the monitor sometimes takes quite awhile to wake up from sleeping (sometimes up to 10 seconds) which slows me down quite frequently when I'm trying to log into my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Ajedi32

customer_reviews.title: Tv to PC this works
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with this monitor.My job requires me to use their computer but my peripherals. I would have to switch the vga cables everytime I logged in and it was a wiry mess.With this one all I have to do is turn off one device and the monitor goes to the other plug source. Perfect for what I needed. Decent price too. I did watch a 4k youtube video to test it and when it wasn't lagging (from my video card) it was stunning.Going to hook up the roku and see if it will play in 4k there.Being it has an HDMI I imagine it will double as a tv too.But it's primary use will be pc
customer_reviews.author: Screaming Mustang 04

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this monitor. It was easy to assemble. It produces sharp, clear images and the wide vs square design allows for easy viewing without having to scroll side to side to view an application like I use for work. I have glaucoma and my eyes get tired and my vision blurs after hours is computer use. You can adjust this monitor to make it easier on your eyes. There is nothing about it that I don't like. UPDATED: April 9,2018-This is my second order for this monitor. I loved it the first time and when my old computer died, I ordered another of these to go with my new HP tower.
customer_reviews.author: Sue C. Dees

customer_reviews.title: Its cheap and looks good at 1920 x 1080
customer_reviews.text: Its cheap and looks good at 1920 x 1080... That said.. it does not come with a HDMI cable so remember to get one.. it has no speakers and it has no way to place it on a vesa stand as is..although the base sits pretty low it does tilt back and forward. If all that works out for you..then it should be fine.. Picture is pleasant. I use it for movies and a streaming pc next to my gaming PC.. I strongly suggest a 144hz monitor for gaming with a good graphics card.. I do not game with this one nor was I expecting too.. did I mention its "cheap"?
customer_reviews.author: MichaelD

customer_reviews.title: resolution for my blinking monitor
customer_reviews.text: this is an update to my review which had been, "My monitor had been blinking and flickering using a hdmi cable and windows 7." The steps below resolved the problem. -In Firefox I clicked the menu button and selected Options -Selected the Advanced panel and then the General tab. -Unchecked, "Use hardware acceleration when available". -Restarted Firefox and the flickering stopped
customer_reviews.author: luckyduck

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this four months ago to replace an old school and bulky Dell monitor that I had been using for many years. I use this as a second monitor when working remotely. I like the bigger screen and the picture is excellent and that is with just using the VGA cable that came with the unit. I am very happy with this monitor and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: John Alapick Top Contributor: Blues Music

customer_reviews.title: It's Cheap In a Good Way
customer_reviews.text: Needed an extra monitor due to COVID work from home situation. Wanted something cheap and it works. But it is really cheap. Plastic, menus, stand, everything. However of the least expensive monitor that is a brand name.
customer_reviews.author: LQ

customer_reviews.title: Failed shortly after warranty ran out
customer_reviews.text: HP's quality and service has declined to the point where I will never buy another HP product. Lots of others on the HP forums echoing the same thing and the same frustrating experience with support. This unit died completely after a year and a half, and after talking to HP support they suggested I email a consumer complaint to support management. They gave me a bogus email address that was immediately rejected. Monitors made with quality do not fail in less than 2 years. Do not buy HP products!
customer_reviews.author: Craig R. Erhorn

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t even work!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my screen on yesterday for my home office. I spoke with HP first, apparently since the logo ornithing is popping up but the Power Coard is lit, it’s aometibg working with the screen....and I have to go out of my way to send it back and wait two weeks...although, I pay for prime for that reason. I’m very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: keshia

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor. Its go great colors and the response time is great! I also love the HDMI port so I can plug it straight into my computer tower and I don't have to worry about an adapter or anything like that. Ive been using a 13yr old HP monitor for a while and compared to this new monitor......well lets just say I would never switch back to the old one. I love HP and have never had a problem with their monitors. I did not get this monitor as part of a promotion or anything like that, I bought it with my own money. I would definitely recommend this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: KayceIsMe

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: The model I purchased was the 22cwa, 21.5-Inch. It does -not- come with a way to wall mount, but that's alright, I don't need that where I have mine installed. The primary reason I purchased this monitor was that it was inexpensive, was a decent size and it could take either VGA or HDMI input. I will use it with my primary computer for the most part, but will also be using it with some Raspberry Pi computers that I fiddle with. After adjusting the display settings on my computer and auto-adjusting the new display, everything looks awesome. I'm pleased with this display and would buy another just like this, or even larger next time.
customer_reviews.author: Asa Jay Laughton

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, works well...
customer_reviews.text: So, it hooks up fine and looks good... resolution is very good for my needs (back up graphics computer)... with only a couple reservations (with the price consideration intact). The VGA hookup is antiquated in my opinion... my video card doesn't even have a VGA output, but fortunately I had an adapter in my 'old' computer apparatus box. It worked. Monitor seems to be clean, bright and worth the low price. BTW... I had mistakenly put the stand base wrong side up - as it seemed several other reviewers might have also... snap button goes on the bottom side... at first it would not snap together securely. Upon closer inspection, I noticed my error and it now works correctly.
customer_reviews.author: StephLadder

customer_reviews.title: HP Pavilion 22cwa 21.5 inch monitor
customer_reviews.text: My older HP SlimLine desktop has just the VGA output, and I neglected to get the VGA to HDMI adapter. I should receive the VGA to HDMI adapter in a couple days, and I will then give an updated review once I have the adapter installed. Otherwise, viewing the VGA output is not bad if all you have is VGA capability. I also recommend to lower the blue light display to save your eye strain.... Update: received the VGA to HDMI adapter and installed. Very easy BTW, and the display is why I upgraded to HD instead of the ol' VGA. Very nice monitor for the price....
customer_reviews.author: BeneDee

customer_reviews.title: This monitor is absolutely amazing for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this monitor for two years now and it is absolutely amazing! It is amazing for gaming and general usage in my opinion. Some people shoot for 4K and although I wish I had the money for one, I went with this HP monitor. I made the right decision. The display is really crisp and you can even adjust the settings such as brightness and contrast to your liking. Watching movies and so forth is also really clear. This monitor was definitely worth every penny I got it for. I plan on getting another one very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Judge N

customer_reviews.title: This is a winner
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a 21' 1920x1080 HDMI/VGA input display to use in "landscape" mode, this one is for you. - Physical design is great (not conspicuous, hp logo is discrete, so is the stand) - Screen quality is top notch (again as long as what you are looking for 1920x1080) - Price is right ($90 as of my writing this review) There really is nothing wrong with it as far as i can tell It may NOT necessarily work for you if you are looking for ultra high definition, fancy display orientation / wall mount, more options than VGA or HDMI to connect
customer_reviews.author: Antoine

customer_reviews.title: Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor but the connection is loose on it. I purchased the monitor for an online course I’m taking and one day I moved my laptop, it bumped against the chord slightly and the monitor went out. Upon troubleshooting, I realized the chord was not connecting well. I tried it again yesterday and it acts as though there is a shortage in the chord.
customer_reviews.author: EH

customer_reviews.title: Nice LED monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor, very easy to set up, bright screen and very nice to lok at. The only caveat I can mention is that it doesn't come with an HDMI cable, just a VGA, so be aware of that, if you prefer HDMI connections. But for the price, I don't think I can ask more. I just needed it for regular browsing, watching youtube videos, emailing, and other minor tasks.
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: Good Monitor, Came With Issues
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice size and it looks good, the colors are all vibrant and clear as they should be. My only gripe is that the power cord came broken (I have to prop it up on something to make it work) and there's one random dead pixel near the bottom of the screen. I would have sent it back but I use it for work and don't have the ability to wait for a new one. I recommend it, though I also advise others to check out the power cord before settling in with it in case this is a reoccurring problem.
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: Great price and product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as soon as this pandemic hit and I realized I’d be working remotely 100%. It works great and it was the best price I found. I’m not tech savvy and was amazed at how easy it was to set up. I literately plugged it into my computer and it displayed right away. I was confused by the listing and wasn’t sure if it came with the stand, but it did, thank god.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa craveiro

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful IPS monitor for an unbeatable price
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful IPS monitor for an unbeatable price. It was such a good deal I had to buy two so I can finally dual monitor at home and I'm glad I did. These look great and have awesome color reproduction. I even found a feature in the OSD that lets you turn off the monitors power button light! That was my only complaint as it was a little too bright and a tiny bit distracting but not anymore! Also if you need to attach it to a vesa mount I bought brackets for $12/piece that work perfect from Amazon so I wouldn't hold that against the monitor, especially for an IPS this low.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good value, clear picture, good desktop size
customer_reviews.text: I like this monitor. It's large enough for viewing everything I need on my desktop, has a clear image and was priced right. I bought it partly because it has an IPS LED screen, which I've read is a good quality screen. It also has a relatively small bezel, which probably fools my eyes/brain into thinking the screen is even larger than it is, which is fine by me since it looks good whether turned on or off. Since I don't stare at it for uninterrupted hours-at-a-time, I can't say how easy it is on the eyes, but it has certainly never bothered me. Regards, Mark
customer_reviews.author: MarkB

customer_reviews.title: After having for spent approx. 676 hours on, barely a year, the screen has gone bad for no reason!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my office and work part-time. It's worked great until today. One of the cords was loose so I rehooked it up and it's all lines on the monitor now. I called local companies and only one was willing to attempt to fix. They said the dianostic fee alone would cost half of what the monitor did originally. I bought it 1/24/2018 and today is 5/1/19. No signs of any damage. It' never been abused or even moved from the desk. Never dropped, and I know since Im the only one here. I'm highly frustrated that this wasnt' made well enough to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Good product support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor for dual display because my laptop screen was getting a little hard to see. The monitor worked great for 31 days and then failed to display. I contacted the HP support and they worked through the trouble shooting stuff and then sent me a replacement. The only difficulty I had was the language issue on the trouble shooting phone call. They charge your credit card one dollar which is refunded when they receive your broken monitor. They also call after you receive the replacement to make sure everything is OK. I was impressed with the HP product support.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this monitor. The screen surface is not reflective. I use the monitor with an HP Chromebox and a regular PC type USB keyboard. I use the HDMI connection. The 22cwa has buttons to press which allows me to set the brightness of the display way lower than the initial setting from the Chromebox which was way too bright. Worked right out of the box with no hassle. It is also relatively lightweight. I would recommend this monitor. Pressing the appropriate keys on the keyboard did not adjust the brightness, so being able to make the adjustment at the monitor is a big plus for me. The images are clean and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: If this was offered in a 55in I would replace all my screens.
customer_reviews.text: I have read all the views about this item and I was skeptical that I could get a great monitor for that price. After it arrived and it was unboxed I was impressed prior to the hook up. This monitor was easy to put together and it’s solid. No vertical adjust which is absolutely fine for me. When I finally plugged it in and turned it on I was in amazement. Smooth great color, size and brightness. Would purchase again and will definitely refer this to my customers and family. YOU CAN NOT BEAT THIS... I wish they made this in a 55inc.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Decent until it starts to turn off on it's own!
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually irritated. These monitors are beautiful and perfect for my needs. However, one of the two I purchased is turning on and off randomly. I've tried to replace the HDMI cable, used a VGA cable, have tightened the cables.... nothing successful. It has been flickering on and off for a good 2 months now. The photos attached were taken seconds after each other. First it's on, 2 seconds later it's off. Then back on again and back off again. Really frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Have to force restart your computer
customer_reviews.text: Monitor connected to Dell Inspiron. I always keep the computer on and after two months when I move bed the mouse to “wake” the computer and the monitor stays black. I checked to make sure it was still on but the only way to get it he monitor to work is to forcefully restart the computer. This just started so I thought it was the computer but I hooked up an old monitor and have had no problems. Really surprised of this from HP and I’m now outside the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Kempskit

customer_reviews.title: not at all true colors: not for artists or photographers!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is not bad but I took off 2 stars for forcing max saturation. No matter what settings I try, I can't get a normal saturation setting. I've tried adjusting the color balance, gamma, everything: this monitor just wants to look like a gumball machine. Everything is super-saturated which might be great for a gamer but is terrible for any artist who wants to create print-ready materials. Disappointed, would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Vexacious

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Price- but does not include HDMI Cable
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, yeah, I know that in the fine print they mention they include a VGA cable, but I haven't seen a VGA cable for years since you'd be hard-pressed to find a computer these days that even have that interface. Other than that tiny inconvenience, very happy with the quality of the monitor at such a competitive price with a reputable brand name. Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor that I recieved to WFH died on me and I didn't feel like going in to get it fixed or get a new one. So I bought this one. Got it for under $100, came the next day. Easy setup and it's been working find for 2 months. Only thing it doesn't go up or down but it does tilt and come with everything you need including cords.
customer_reviews.author: Julia W

customer_reviews.title: Just one problem...
customer_reviews.text: Good monitor, just one problem... the power supply isn't internal so there's a power-brick that comes with this unit. That wouldn't be so bad if the cord between the monitor and the brick weren't so short. It's only 36" long which makes it hard to put the brick on the floor, in which case it has to sit up on your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Pythagoras

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't stop flashing
customer_reviews.text: Nothing worse than having to repack and ship an item like this to return but I could not get the thing to stop flashing and timing out after ridiculously short periods. I did everything on all forums and, frankly, for a $90 order I'm not sitting on hold for tech support. Always troubling when you can't find any information at all on your specific piece of tech and just get sent to the "all HP monitors" section. Will continue on my tiny laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L. Livesay

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price but suffers on backlighting in bright conditions
customer_reviews.text: The resolution on this monitor is pretty good for the price and it has lots of adjustment options. Color is also good but nothing to get excited about. Unfortunately, I think it a little dim and wish it had more back lighting. I have a large window next to my computer in my office and I don't have much control on the light coming through it. When the sun is bright, I have a hard time reading with this monitor. It easily catches glare from other light sources and bright fluorescent lighting. The price was very good but doesn't outweigh the back lighting issue. I'm tempted to replace it after a month.
customer_reviews.author: Historian

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for a great price, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Best monitor for the price. Highly recommend. Be aware that depending on your computer you may have to adjust the resolution to get the best image quality, and the this resolution may not be the default "recommended resolution." Very simple to do though, just a few clicks on the monitor buttons or computer display settings. I love that you can turn on a blue light filter using the monitor buttons. It's much bigger than I had imagined so I ended up giving my roommate the second one I purchased because I never needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product - great performance.
customer_reviews.text: I have recently restarted my gaming (I majorly play CSGO) and this Monitor is super helpful. the graphics are amazing and so is the ppi ratio. I like the way the back lights can be adjusted which usually yield better performance during the game play. Awesome buy!
customer_reviews.author: Nikhil Lohiya

customer_reviews.title: Monitir part great but the stand broke right away.
customer_reviews.text: Thank god for duct tape because the stand was defective - otherwise a good monitor I will not waste money on again due to the beforementioned stand. I expected a lot more from this brand but we seem to have entered a new age of shoddy and this is just another example of why this brand consistently fails to beat it competitors. Should have gone with a "sounds like bell."
customer_reviews.author: teaching me

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 4 years ago
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when I made my budget build in college and it's held up nicely through 4 long years. No problems with any coloring or pixels as far as I can tell. Does the job for 99 dollars in terms of brightness and gaming. It's been a tank for me and even though I'll probably purchase a higher-end monitor in a little bit, I'll definitely keep this as a second monitor till it dies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Budget Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Much better than I expected. For $88, this did the trick for my much needed monitor replacement, which was purchased in late 2009. This is definitely made for budgets, as it seems some corners were cut. It has a somewhat cheap feel and look to it. No HDMI cable (yes, I know it made it clear only a VGA was included). The screen area is a lot bigger than I thought it would be when I took it out of the box. Otherwise, the image is clear and bright, which is what I needed. No frills. Nothing fancy. Nothing spectacular. If that is what you need, this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin

customer_reviews.title: HP Monitor.  Born: May 2, 2019  Died: July 24, 2019  Rest in Pieces
customer_reviews.text: When it was working, I liked this monitor. It does NOT have speakers. One day, 2 1/2 months after receipt, it stopped working. Period. Nothing. Nada. Contacted HP support. They are sending me a new replacement monitor. The problem I have with this is that they are charging me $21 in shipping charges on a monitor that cost $99. (Now it only costs $89). Seems like a high price for a monitor that only lasted that long. Doesn't seem fair. HP should be paying the shipping. It is clearly a quality control issue. Will definitely question ever buying a monitor from HP again. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this computer for about 24 hours. So far I love it, especially for the price. I have read about light bleeding around the edges of the monitor on IPS monitors but so far have not experienced this myself. One feature I would have liked to have is built in speakers but for the price this is not a problem at all. The stand is not too wobbly, and you can adjust the tilt well. Overall great monitor. The price is great, the picture is great, the bezel is great, and I will be keeping this monitor as long as possible. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor, no vesa mount adapter included.
customer_reviews.text: I have no issues with the monitor, except the product description plainly said it would include a vesa mount adapter which was not included in the packaging. Had that been made apparent, I would have ordered one with the monitor and wall mount that I can not use now.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Rabalais

customer_reviews.title: Bright, clear, and a lot better than what you would expect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for my very first desktop PC set up and didn't want to spend a ton of money. The specs seemed good enough for the people who were helping me with accessories and basically said "it's small, but it'll do". It's honestly a great monitor. It's sleek & really clear. It actually looks a lot bigger. When my friends came over to check everything out (they usually have two monitors much bigger than mine) they all were really impressed by it and thought it was a lot better than expected. Great first monitor! I'm considering buying another one & getting on that two-monitor wave!
customer_reviews.author: SReview

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: This monitor had a nice, super bright screen. 2 months later, the monitor died. The reason is that this monitor doesn't use a simple 110V power cord from the monitor to the wall plug. The 110V current goes to an inverter (a big black box that is part of the power cord). This inverter reduces the current from 110v to 19v and then plugs into the monitor. Too complex. There was a failure in the power cord and it is not available separately. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect monitor for starters
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this budget of a beast nearly a year ago for my new setup station. The IPS 1080p display is really nice, especially with the price range. Viewing angles are great, and even the 5ms delay doesn't affect me (that is) The design of this monitor is sleek looking. However, there are drawbacks to the design. For one, there are only 2 inputs, VGA and HDMI, but it doesn't bother me. This is expected in this price range. This monitor also uses a proprietary mounting system, but the stand can be removed and can be replaced by a 3rd party VESA mount. So you can use this monitor with an armstand if its necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Jacy

customer_reviews.title: 2 monitors look different
customer_reviews.text: They're great monitors, besides the only one hdmi and vga ports. And also my confusing problem, I bought 2 monitors and they are the same but they have different menu types and different colors. Ive checked and rechecked that they're on the same color settings and they just look different. I don't know why and I'm sure that they are the same monitor. It's a confusing thing that I'd like explained by someone from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Nice display, but poor integration with Mac
customer_reviews.text: Display is nice, but it doesn't integrate well with my iMac so I'm constantly having to unplug and replug the video cables (which will eventually degrade the connectors). There isn't a clear method (of unplugging or restarting the computer) for getting the HP monitor to recognize my iMac connection, so it's a time waster for me. Sometimes I just give up when I'm busy and use a single monitor because it's such a pain. HP doesn't offer a fix for this and instead defers to Apple updates. For a $100-ish monitor, it is nice overall, but what good is a monitor if it doesn't work all the time as intended?
customer_reviews.author: Gabster

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was a little unsure about buying this monitor simply because of the price, but I'm so glad I did! I purchased this to connect to my laptop so there could be a little more space on my desk. The clarity of the screen is great, especially for the price. There are several adjustments that can be made for brightness, contrast, and it even comes with an option for a blue light filter. I absolutely love the large display and wish I Would be have found this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Great 2nd Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE! This was a great purchase for my 2nd screen in my office space! I work from home occasionally and have a main laptop but boy is it a treat having a 2nd monitor. Pros: great picture/resolution. Excellent price, there were comparable monitors for $25+ more. I love the wide screen, makes looking at Excel that much easier! Hooked up with ease to my laptop using the VGA cord that came with the monitor. Cons: I wish the height was adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndal S.

customer_reviews.title: Great picture / good price
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor!!! So bright and clear and cheery! Super easy set up, right out of the box. Plugged into my MacBook air with a 13 inch display, and started dragging windows over to it immediately. No set up required in display or preferences etc. Just the stand and the plugs. Just had to buy the expensive Mac adapter to interface with the VGA cord provided with the monitor. It also has an HDMI option but the Mac doesn't have that so VGA to thunderbolt adaptor is my set up. Like I said it is really clear. Crystal clear. We’ll see how long it lasts, but for now I’m happy with my purchase. Ready to get some work done!
customer_reviews.author: Papa Chote`

customer_reviews.title: Has been a solid monitor for 2.5 Years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monitor from Amazon in March 2018. It is August 2020 and this monitor has survived 3 moves and daily use for gaming, movies...etc. I would 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor for my wife that has been working from home for the last weeks. She has a nice HP Laptop, but the display is quite small. This 21" arrived yesterday. Set it up easily and she was VERY Happy (It was a surprise)..... Wife Happy..... EVERYBODY HAPPY !!
customer_reviews.author: JaxDave

customer_reviews.title: Terrible -- four hours and it's already not working . . .
customer_reviews.text: Set it up today and within 4 hours not working -- lines running veritically through it and fading in and out of brightness. Wish I had bought another clearly.
customer_reviews.author: lillianw

product_meta.title: HP Pavilion 22cwa 21.5-Inch Full HD 1080p IPS LED Monitor, Tilt, VGA and HDMI (T4Q59AA) - Black
product_meta.description: Experience content on a multi-functional monitor with the best specs at the right price. The HP Pavilion 22cwa 21.5” Full HD display with an IPS panel is versatile for gaming with vivid colors and provides 178-degree viewing for the best quality from any position. A VGA cable is included for your convenience and an HDMI port can turn any desk into a multi-display setup. Get trusted HP performance for your home or office.
feature_bullets: Resolution & panel — 21.5-inch full HD monitor (1920 x 1080p @ 60 Hz) with 16:9 aspect ratio and an anti-glare IPS LED-backlit panel (2 million pixels)
Response time — 7ms with overdrive and vivid color scheme for a smooth picture that looks crisp and fluid without motion blur
Adjustable viewing — Adjustable tilt (-5° to 25°) with 178° positional viewing for the best quality at any angle
Connectivity — Open wedge contemporary design allows easy access to VGA and HDMI with HDCP support for laptop or multi-monitor setups includes - AC power cord, VGA cable, and power adapter
Compatibility — Plug and play for all OS such as Windows & Mac OS for laptop connectivity and PS4 (note: USB-C/Thunderbolt 3 to HDMI adapters required for 2016 MacBook Pros or later)
Brightness & contrast — 250 nits of brightness, up to 8,000,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio, and up to 1000:1 static contrast ratio
Responsibly made — Save your wallet with an Energy Star certified monitor that meets strict energy-efficiency guidelines and helps reduce your carbon footprint
Warranty — One-year limited warranty with 24-hour, 7 days a week web support when shipped from and sold by Amazon
